replies.body:
With that attitude how do you expect us to get better?
It's so easy for everyone to focus on the negatives.
It's so easy for everyone to complain about every little thing that does and does not get done on here.
It's so easy for everyone to turn on each other, both in the community and in the staff team.
It's so easy to assume that this server will "die" because we've had a few shitty weeks.

And yea, we've had obvious communication problems, former staff are acting like dickheads and the development on the server is slow.

But people are so focused on the negatives that they forget about the positives.
They forget about the good times that are still being had, people are still having fun despite the current situation of the server. 

It's this determination and positivity that will get us through this speed bump.

Just when you think it's the end, you turn round the corner and continue your journey. 

;)

replies.body: With this attitude I am telling you "You need to fix something." I am not sugar coating anything. Mods have communication problem, they have "can't really handle the forums" problems. Also if you think I don't understand I don't. I am an admin of a server that has 4 other admins and 31 mods. We don't let community problems run on too long, we don't let problems go on at all. Also if you are wondering why a player base looks for the negatives that is completely normal. Apparently block lag is fixed but it was presented so badly it didn't knock the negative feedback that has been coming from players for months of bottled up frustration. I do have to hand it to you. You are the first mod to answer my concerns in a while. You can't just walk into lava and act it isn't there. You have to think of a way to over come the lava way to get to your goal. I honesty think you are the best the mod team offers but it is a long road and if this keeps up the server will eventually collapse on itself.

replies.body:
Guys, I think the first thing we need is positivity.
We all need to get along, once that is done, the rest will just fall in place. I know it seems dark, but if we give up, we submit to the darkness. We allow it to control us, to turn us against each other. Please, for the sake or our server, be kind, forgiving, and don't be afraid to be wrong (This includes the staff and the community) A city cannot reach it's peak if there is a civil war within it's walls. The same applies for this sever, OUR server. Please everyone, if we can be supportive, we can build back what we have lost. Share the love, abolish the anger, salt and frustration. We need this to step forward.

(This is for everyone, not some people specifically. We are part of the server, and it doesn't matter who the specific person of the server is, because it all comes back to the entire thing all together...Avicus)

<3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D <3 :D

replies.body:
Obviously as staff members we are role models for the community.
That means we be professional and mature while moderating and hanging out.

But we're people too, we're not some magical beings plucked out of the special tree of perfection and awesomeness.
We're just people.

Sometimes when a staff member screws up, people give them too much shit about it.
Everyone makes mistakes and we can all be immature at times.

Now, I am in no way excusing the poor behaviour that some people have been showing over time but it's just something to think about.

Staff are players too, we're part of the community just as you are.

Peachy told us a while ago that staff are allowed to temp retire once, and if they retire a second time, they'll have to go through the process of applications or handpicking. Vlad was just stating a rule :P

replies.body:
We're trying are best. Please, let us try. You guys can't expect things to happen in a snap of a finger. Things take time, Kylo developing stuff with Java and whatnot doesn't take 3 minutes.

Staff trying to organize and get ourselves together doesn't take a minute either. Don't you guys think that people retired because of flak from both sides?

When you make unnecessary topics like this one it severely drops our morale (Staff: Mods) and makes us think that we're doing our jobs in vain. Absolutely no appreciation and recognition. 

When I was a MapDev and when I was a simple old regular, I was busy criticizing the Moderator team and being constructive with them. A senior approached me for some advice, the mods knew and understood what I was saying. I swear, you won't be bashed. In fact, I was hand-picked to this position even though I created my topic.

None of us will shoot you guys down for creating constructive posts perfectly. Not create a travesty of a topic like this one. What is the point of this topic? It only induces disunity and lessens morale. It allows negative elements to come on and bash the server even more. 

Speaking of an element...

@Aphelion, yes yes that's nice. But why are you still here then? If you've lost faith why don't you leave? I know that if I lost faith I would leave the server to rot in peace. If you don't want to be bothered with the server yet you have the impulse to go on and spread negativity then perhaps ask for a forum-ban? 

It makes no sense saying you've lost faith yet you're still here.

replies.body: i honestly dont know what to say here. everyone here who lost faith, you aren't helping at all. if you lost faith, why are you still here? there's always room for improvement.  just because some things have happened doesn't mean its all over. i still think avicus has a chance. for everyone who still cares, we need to try to do something to get avicus back up. just because we lost some staff doesn't mean the server is rip. we need to figure out something to get everyones faith back, something that will attract more players, i dont know. hopefully staff apps will be coming soon or some way of getting staff so the numbers can rise again, because i cant lie, we do need more staff. i remember when there was 3 admins, 8 sr mods, and 42 mods. alot of them retired, and for good reasons. and all you people who dont like the staff, dont just say they suck, give them a reason that can help them so they can actually improve, dont just say "oh i hate this staff member", give them something to make them better, because im 100% sure, that that is their goal. i dont think avicus is rip. i still think there is a chance to get back in the run as it used to be.

replies.body: I agree with the staff, and I agree that things can be changed for the better, avicus isn't rip, hooray, etc etc.  One thing I do have a problem with is this "I don't want to leak anything" business.  What?  Isn't that the point of the community?  Shouldn't you be able to tell us what you're doing so we can give feedback?  So we can make suggestions?  You're not some game company trying to build hype, you're our only hope of this server lasting.  The best move for you now is to tell us your ideas, run them by us first.  Tell us what you're hoping change, and admit where things need fixing.  We are your best source for doing thing that make the community happy, because as it happens, we are the community.

reply_to.body: I agree that we don't have to know everything, but I don't think we should have to "be nosy and get in the staff team's faces" to know what they plan on doing.  They don't have to tell use everything, no, but there shouldn't be anything you're afraid to say for fear of "leaking".

replies.body:
Here is a few things: Staff barely know how to handle themselves. This has improved looking at this thread but some staff still haven't shown they can handle themselves. You are one of the higher staff members that can act better than most. Just a reminder to staff but you ARE the leaders. You have to act as leaders all the time and getting swept up in children games of personal insults or just placing the blame game is never acceptable.
A good way to restore my faith in staff for me and others is by making your presence known on the forums. When there are threads like these it is the only time a staff member indicates that they do something. This is a little rant but a few days ago there was a flame heavy thread and there would of been a flame if a leader didn't come. Who is this leader? It was me. That isn't me bragging because I was sick of it. No staff indicated that they were acting as a leader when I asked a question a few times in the middle of the thread about the rules. and for 6 hours of waiting and seeing staff in other places on the forums I lost full faith in staff. Look at all threads, if there is little indication that a staff is needed don't look the other way. Help. 
Next is the secrets in the staff team. The devs are more open about their work and if that is happening you have a problem. The tensions between players and staff and other players are rising. Being so secretive is not helping. The players feel left out and if that is happening they want no part of the staff. Just try to make players know a few things so if you still want secrets you can. 
Also a little into my mind. I am anti BS and I am a realist when it comes to situations. Avicus will die if staff vs community relations don't improve.

reply_to.body:
We're trying are best. Please, let us try. You guys can't expect things to happen in a snap of a finger. Things take time, Kylo developing stuff with Java and whatnot doesn't take 3 minutes.

Staff trying to organize and get ourselves together doesn't take a minute either. Don't you guys think that people retired because of flak from both sides?

When you make unnecessary topics like this one it severely drops our morale (Staff: Mods) and makes us think that we're doing our jobs in vain. Absolutely no appreciation and recognition. 

When I was a MapDev and when I was a simple old regular, I was busy criticizing the Moderator team and being constructive with them. A senior approached me for some advice, the mods knew and understood what I was saying. I swear, you won't be bashed. In fact, I was hand-picked to this position even though I created my topic.

None of us will shoot you guys down for creating constructive posts perfectly. Not create a travesty of a topic like this one. What is the point of this topic? It only induces disunity and lessens morale. It allows negative elements to come on and bash the server even more. 

Speaking of an element...

@Aphelion, yes yes that's nice. But why are you still here then? If you've lost faith why don't you leave? I know that if I lost faith I would leave the server to rot in peace. If you don't want to be bothered with the server yet you have the impulse to go on and spread negativity then perhaps ask for a forum-ban? 

It makes no sense saying you've lost faith yet you're still here.

replies.body:
Wait wait wait wait. We are all taking this a bit too far. Why is everyone giving the staff such a hard time when they are trying their best to improve. We can't hurry them up and in all honesty what is this achieving.
Yes they have seen the multiple posts on the forums but it's not like they're actually helping resolve the staff problem.
Let's, as a community, stand back and let them do their work. They seem to be handling most problems pretty well and personally I've seen a little improvement. 
Please, let's all stop escalating the situation so much we all think that Avicus is dying. 

In my opinion the staff need to start being more open about a lot of things with the community. Other than that we should just stand back a bit and let them do their work.

If anyone doesn't like it here you're free to leave anytime you want.
